Articles.Content:
Windows7, x64

KSP 0.24.2 x64

I might be the first to care, but I found my reputation isn't growing any more. I'm at 970 rep now (as can be seen when landing a Kerbal back home), but whenever I do a contract which should add another couple of hundred reputation to my stock, it just doesn't. I'm stuck at 970 for eternity as it seems.

Is reputation maybe capped at 1k?

Haven't the foggiest.

On a related note, though: if they start making reputation matter in .25, they're going to have to do something about the obvious ways to cheat it. At the moment, you can build masses of rep just by driving a bus full of Kerbals onto the launchpad and then recovering it.
That doesn't work long - I only gain 0.1 rep for a retrieved Kerbal after touchdown (or so the recovering window tells me). So there is a diminishing value somewhere.
That's still 422.4 rep every time you park one of these on the launchpad, though:

I know that reputation suffers from diminishing returns, the higher (or lower) the rep, the harder it is to increase (or decrease).

I will investigate this, though.
